intro: Antiphytum ehrenbergii, commonly known as the desert star. It is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant features a compact, cushion-like growth form with small, fleshy leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in late spring to early summer. Antiphytum ehrenbergii is well adapted to hot, dry environments and is often found in rocky soils.
